aesi
Class JavaSourceFileObject

java.lang.Object
  javax.tools.SimpleJavaFileObject
      aesi.JavaSourceFileObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.tools.FileObject, javax.tools.JavaFileObject
public class JavaSourceFileObject
extends javax.tools.SimpleJavaFileObject

A datastructure java needs to compile source within source. The object needs as input a URI, which as far as I know is not used. This makes me sad but at least we got it to work!

Field Detail

fileContent

private java.lang.String fileContent
A string that represents the fileContent. It was not sure if the SimpleJavaFileObject read this from the URI but no chances were taken and getCharContent(boolean ignoreEncodingErrors) was Overridden!

Constructor Detail

JavaSourceFileObject

public JavaSourceFileObject(java.io.File file,
                            java.lang.String iFileContent)
                     throws java.net.URISyntaxException
The constructor to store the simplest info about a file in a really complicated manner. It's especially horrible how a URISyntaxException had to thrown... :( Overloaded methods can be used here.

Parameters:
file - The file object that represents a file.
iFileContent - The string that represents the content of the file.
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - An exception that had to be thrown and I could do nothing about, sorry guys! sorry 'bout that!
See Also:
SimpleJavaFileObject, URISyntaxException
Method Detail

getCharContent

public java.lang.CharSequence getCharContent(boolean ignoreEncodingErrors)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
Overridden because we do not know what the JavaSourceFileObject does with this method and because we already store the fileContent? But I have the feeling we do not actually use this (but it can still be useful somewhere in the source code of sun).

Specified by:
getCharContent in interface javax.tools.FileObject
Overrides:
getCharContent in class javax.tools.SimpleJavaFileObject
Parameters:
ignoreEncodingErrors - self explanatory
Returns:
A CharSequence that is the content of the file/uri. Our string is probably implicitly casted to a CharSequence.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - self explanatory
